zone.line: enjoyed ages of pleasure: now indeed I am grown
old in grief; my steps are lo feeble like
those of age; I have become peevish and
unfit for life; so having passed little more
than twenty years upon the earth I am
more fit for my narrow grave than
many are when they reach the natural
term of their lives.
Again and again I have passed
over in my remembrance the different
scenes of my short life: if the world is a
stage and I mely merely an actor on it
my part has been strange, and, alas!
tragical. Almost from infancy^ I was thrown
deprived of the ^all the testimonies of affection which children gene
rally receive; I was thrown entirely upon
my own resources, and I enjoyed what I may
almost call unnatural pleasures, for they
were dreams and not realities. The earth was
to me a magic lantern and I gazer, and
a listener but no actor; but then came
